title: Projects
text: Crohn’s disease (CD) is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease affecting all segments of the digestive tract, with the ileum being the most severely inflamed region. Current treatments mainly focus on suppressing inflammation, but severe cases often require surgery. Alterations in the gut microbiome are strongly linked to CD, especially the presence of bacteria within cavitating fistulous microlesions (CavFT) in the gut wall, which exacerbate inflammation and tissue damage.

Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

Welcome to my website!
I’m Sadia Ahmed, a biotechnologist and microbiologist fascinated by the hidden world of microbes and their impact on human health. My research focuses on probiotics, postbiotics, and their potential for improving gut and skin health, combining food biotechnology, microbiology, and immunology.
I’ve had the opportunity to work at the National Institute for Biotechnology and Genetic Engineering (NIBGE) in Pakistan and at Case Western Reserve University (CWRU) in the U.S., exploring the development, safety, and therapeutic effects of probiotics in Inflammatory bowel disease.
On this site, you’ll find my publications, ongoing projects, and collaborations.. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

title: Projects
text:
GitHub Project

To explore microbiome-targeted therapeutic approaches, our study investigates the potential of food-derived lactic acid bacteria (LAB) probiotics—specifically bile-resistant Pediococcus and Enterococcus strains—to mitigate CavFT-associated bacterial colonization and inflammation in a spontaneous CD-like ileitis mouse model (SAMP1/YitFc, SAMP) and in healthy control mice (C57BL/6J, B6). We evaluate both microbial and histopathological outcomes to assess probiotic efficacy in modulating disease severity.
